skill.name: brainstorming
skill.description: Use when creating or developing anything, before writing code or implementation plans - refines rough ideas into fully-formed designs through structured Socratic questioning, alternative exploration, and incremental validation

skill.author: ArieGoldkin

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation and templates. No executable code, scripts, network operations, or file access capabilities beyond reading its own documentation files.

content.user_title: Refine ideas into designs through structured brainstorming
content.value_statement: Ideas often start vague and incomplete. This skill guides you through a three-phase process to clarify requirements, explore alternatives, and validate designs incrementally before any code is written.
actual_capabilities: Guides three-phase brainstorming process (Understanding, Exploration, Design)
Uses structured questioning to clarify vague requirements
Presents architectural alternatives with explicit trade-offs
Validates design incrementally in 200-300 word sections
Provides templates for decision matrices and design documents
limitations: Does not write code or implementation plans
Does not access or modify project files
Does not execute commands or scripts
Requires user engagement for effective brainstorming

use_cases.title: Clarify product requirements
use_cases.description: Transform high-level feature ideas into clear, validated requirements before development begins

use_cases.title: Explore architectural approaches
use_cases.description: Evaluate technology choices with explicit trade-off analysis and decision documentation

use_cases.title: Prevent costly rework
use_cases.description: Catch design gaps early by validating assumptions before implementation starts

prompt_templates.title: Initial idea
prompt_templates.prompt: I have an idea for [feature/product]. Help me explore and design it.

prompt_templates.title: Architecture selection
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to build [system]. What are the best approaches and their trade-offs?

prompt_templates.title: Requirements clarification
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me understand what I actually need for [project]. Ask me questions to clarify.

prompt_templates.title: Design validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Here is my initial design for [feature]. Validate it section by section and identify gaps.

output_examples.input: I want to add user authentication to my web app
output: Clarifying question about storage location (Session, Local, Cookies, Server-side)
Success criteria definition (session duration, device support, logout behavior)
Architecture options with trade-offs (JWT, Session ID with Redis, JWT + Refresh Token)
Incremental design validation covering auth flow, session management, and security measures

best_practices: Announce skill usage at the start of brainstorming sessions
Ask one question at a time and wait for responses before proceeding
Always propose 2-3 approaches with explicit trade-off comparisons
Validate each design section before moving to the next
anti_patterns: Jumping to solutions before understanding the problem
Presenting only one approach without alternatives
Skipping incremental validation and presenting full designs at once
Forcing linear progression when new information requires revisiting earlier phases

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It uses the AskUserQuestion tool for structured choices.

faq.question: What types of projects benefit most?
faq.answer: Complex features, new systems, or any project where requirements are vague or multiple approaches could work.

faq.question: How does this integrate with existing workflows?
faq.answer: Use this before writing code or implementation plans. Document results using the included templates.

faq.question: Is any data stored or transmitted?
faq.answer: No. This is a prompt-based skill with no code execution, file access, or network operations.

faq.question: What if requirements change mid-session?
faq.answer: The skill supports non-linear progression. Return to earlier phases to incorporate new constraints.

faq.question: How is this different from general prompting?
faq.answer: It provides a structured three-phase framework with explicit tool usage guidelines and templates.
